intro: Lagenaria angolensis, commonly known as the African bottle gourd, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant produces large, hollow fruits that can be used as containers, a unique feature of the species. Its leaves are broad and lobed, while its flowers are typically yellow with five petals. Lagenaria angolensis is adapted to grow in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient crop in tropical and subtropical regions.
